EUVpy.tools.processIrradiances module

EUVpy.tools.processIrradiances.getIrr(dateStart, dateEnd, source)[source]

Given a starting date and an ending date, automatically download irradiance data from LISIRD for a specific source, including FISM2 (daily or stan bands) or SEE (Level 3 daily).

Parameters:

  • dateStart (str) – The starting date for the data in YYYY-MM-DD format.

  • dateEnd (str) – The ending date for the data in YYYY-MM-DD format.

  • source ({'FISM2', 'FISM2S', 'SEE'}) – The type of data to be obtained. Valid inputs are: - FISM2 (for daily averages of FISM2 data) - FISM2S (for daily averages of FISM2 standard bands, according to Solomon and Qian 2005) - SEE (for Level 3 daily averages of TIMED/SEE data)

Returns:

  • times (numpy.ndarray) – Datetime values for each spectrum.

  • wavelengths (numpy.ndarray) – Wavelength bins (bin boundaries) for the spectral data.

  • irradiance (numpy.ndarray) – A 2D array where each row is a spectrum at a particular time, and the columns are wavelength bands.

EUVpy.tools.processIrradiances.obtainFism1(fismFiles, euv_bins, saveLoc=None)[source]

Given muliple FISM1 .dat files, get the information from each band, using code developed by Dr. Aaron Ridley.

Parameters:

  • fismfiles (arraylike) – A list or array of .dat files containing FISM1 data (the full VUV spectrum from .1nm to 195nm at 1 nm resolution.

  • euv_bins (dictionary) – EUV bins with which to rebin the FISM1 data. Obtained from fism2_process.rebin_fism.

  • saveLoc (str) – Optional argument that controls where pickle files are saved.

Returns:

  • irrTimes (numpy.ndarray) – A 1d array of datetimes corresponding to each set of irradiance values.

  • irrArray (numpy.ndarray) – An ndarray containing all of the individual 59 irradiance values in each band from all .dat files.

EUVpy.tools.processIrradiances.obtainFism2(myFism2File, bands=False)[source]

Load in spectrum data from a FISM2 file downloaded from CU Boulder’s LISIRD website.

Parameters:

  • myFism2File (str) – The location of the NETCDF4 file.

  • bands (bool) – If True, loads in the data segmented into the Solomon and Qian 2005 standard bands.

Returns:

  • datetimes (numpy.ndarray) – An array of datetimes for each TIMED/SEE spectra.

  • wavelengths (numpy.ndarray) – A one-dimensional array of wavelengths at which there are irradiance values.

  • irradiances (numpy.ndarray) – A two-dimensional array of irradiance values at each time.

  • uncertainties (numpy.ndarray) – A two-dimensional array of irradiance uncertainty values at each time.

EUVpy.tools.processIrradiances.obtainNRLSSIS2(filename)[source]

Given a NRLSSI2 NETCDF4 file, load in and return the timestamps, wavelengths, irradiances, and uncertainties.

Parameters:

filename (str) – The NETCDF4 file containing TIMED/SEE data.

Returns:

  • datetimes (numpy.ndarray) – An array of datetimes for each TIMED/SEE spectra.

  • wavelengths (numpy.ndarray) – A one-dimensional array of wavelengths at which there are irradiance values.

  • bandwidths (numpy.ndarray) – The width of the corresponding band for each irradiance measurement.

  • irradiance (numpy.ndarray) – A two-dimensional array of irradiance values at each time.

  • uncertainties (numpy.ndarray) – A two-dimensional array of irradiance uncertainty values at each time.

EUVpy.tools.processIrradiances.obtainSDO(seeFile)[source]

Given an SDO NETCDF4 file, load in and return the timestamps, wavelengths, irradiances, and uncertainties.

Parameters:

seeFile (str) – The NETCDF4 file containing SDO/EVE data.

Returns:

  • datetimes (numpy.ndarray) – An array of datetimes for each SDO/EVE spectra.

  • wavelengths (numpy.ndarray) – A one-dimensional array of wavelengths at which there are irradiance values.

  • irradiances (numpy.ndarray) – A two-dimensional array of irradiance values at each time.

  • uncertainties (numpy.ndarray) – A two-dimensional array of irradiance uncertainty values at each time.

EUVpy.tools.processIrradiances.obtainSEE(seeFile)[source]

Given a TIMED/SEE NETCDF4 file, load in and return the timestamps, wavelengths, irradiances, and uncertainties.

Parameters:

seeFile (str) – The NETCDF4 file containing TIMED/SEE data.

Returns:

  • datetimes (numpy.ndarray) – An array of datetimes for each TIMED/SEE spectra.

  • wavelengths (numpy.ndarray) – A one-dimensional array of wavelengths at which there are irradiance values.

  • irradiances (numpy.ndarray) – A two-dimensional array of irradiance values at each time.

  • uncertainties (numpy.ndarray) – A two-dimensional array of irradiance uncertainty values at each time.
